info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 9:56AM EDT until July 14 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of Lycoming County along the Muncy Creek near and just upstream of Muncy.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams have leveled off or are falling slightly from the excessive rainfall overnight. But, renewed flooding is highly likely, and should push the creek back up as additional rainfall occurs today.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated flooding due to overnight thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen overnight upstream in the Muncy Creek basin. - Again, additional rainfall is expected later today. Amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area in places that get thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muncy and Hughesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
